content: Today Kira did nothing but code, so I had to entertain myself. For a while I tried to catch my tail, but once that got old I tried to help Kira by jumping up in front of the computer. If staring at the computer is entertaining for Kira, I'll join in too. Gotta say I don't get the appeal, but what do cats know?

Cats are supposed to sleep 16-20 hours a day, which seems like a lot to humans, but do you know why? It's because around 1 a.m. when everyone else is asleep I gotta go fast, I gotta go Very VERY fast. I dash up and down the stairs, and see how fast I can touch one wall then the other. All that sprinting really wears me out, so I need a lot of naps. Sometimes I get Kira to chase me by meowing at them and then running away and waiting for them to catch up. Humans are not very fast at all ^_^
Today I saw a fox out the window. It came right up and we touched noses through the glass. I couldn't smell anything, of course, but it was very interesting. I've never seen anything like it before.

Today Kira tricked me into thinking I was getting a cuddle, but instead they trimmed my nails! I let them do it because I get a treat at the end, but I did flick my tail the whole time so they would know I was not pleased. I even opened my mouth and put my teeth on their hand because it was taking so long, but I'm not really mad so I never bite. I just don't have any other way to say 'hurry it up!'
Warm weather is the best for taking a nap. I like to stretch out by the window and take a snooze. If I get bored I can just roll around a bit and go back to sleep.
After all the excitement yesterday, I'm feeling very lively. Kira's friend came to visit and played with me using the laser pointer. Someday I'll catch that red dot!
There are tons of loud noises today! At first I hid under the bed like any cat would, but then I wanted to run to the window and take a look outside. Everyone is looking very festive waving flags.
